meanings.definition: To dislocate or move out of place
meanings.sent1: The athlete's shoulder kept luxating during the game, causing immense pain.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to carefully maneuver the luxating gear back into its proper position.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten enjoyed luxating the pieces of the puzzle just to watch everyone scramble.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed to luxate its creaky floorboards with every step, as if trying to escape its own structure.
meanings.sent5: The loose doorknob luxated in my hand, making it difficult to open the door.

meanings.definition: To shift or move from its normal position
meanings.sent1: The tectonic plates luxate slowly over time, causing earthquakes.
meanings.sent2: The painting on the wall seemed to luxate slightly every time someone walked by.
meanings.sent3: The wind luxated the leaves on the tree, creating a soothing rustling sound.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts luxated from one worry to the next, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The boat luxated on the gentle waves, rocking its passengers to sleep.
